SENT.plain: The authors discuss the results obtained in patients who underwent foramen magnum decompression for longstanding advanced Chiari I malformation in which marked spinal cord atrophy was present
This 50-year-old woman presented with progressive quadriparesis and sensory disorders
Magnetic resonance imaging revealed the descent of cerebellar tonsils and medulla associated with remarkable C1-L2 spinal cord atrophy
After a C-1 laminectomy-based foramen magnum decompression, arachnoid dissection and duraplasty were undertaken
These procedures resulted in remarkable neurological improvement, even after 40 years of clinical progression
Spinal cord atrophy may be caused by chronic pressure of entrapped cerebrospinal fluid in the spinal canal
